subject: Relationships
title: Fear of Being Alone
description: A fast breakdown of Fear of Being Alone for builders.

hook.text: 'A bad relationship is better than no relationship.' That belief keeps millions trapped in misery.

buildup.text: Fear of being alone â€” monophobia â€” affects 30% of adults and is a primary reason people stay in toxic bonds.

discovery.text: Society reinforces it: single people are pitied, coupled people are celebrated, regardless of relationship quality.

twist.text: Studies show single people have higher well-being than those in unhappy relationships. Alone isn't the worst option.

climax.text: Being alone is uncomfortable. Being in a toxic relationship is destructive. Discomfort is survivable; destruction isn't.

punchline.text: Alone is uncomfortable. A toxic relationship is destructive. Choose wisely.

quiz.question: What do studies show about single people vs. those in unhappy relationships?
